TopicTitle: Is there a way to automatically refuel tanks?

Articles.Content:
Hello KSP forums,

I'm wondering if it is possible to have tanks automatically be refueled with a few clicks of a button? I went overboard with fuel tanks on one of my ships, and I want to make refueling it quick (it's supposed to be reusable) and relatively easy. If I can't, please tell me of a mod that will allow me to.

- Jasper

there is no easy way via stock.   I have suggested in the suggestion area that they make "open part window" an option for the 1-9 button commands, as this would significantly speed up the process. (if a landers tanks all open with the press of a button,  then all you need to do is hold alt while you right click on the tank you want it to come from and select "out")   not sure if the idea gained any traction tho.    I would love if they did it lol it would make life WAY easier.

 

not sure about any mods for it.

 

you can try this , the creator mentioned in my suggestion thread he would look into part window opening via command, but i havent followed to see if he put it in.

 

Edited February 8, 2017 by DD_bwest
I like the GPOSpeed Fuel Pump mod, but there are a few that work well.
I believe hyperedit has the function to refuel your craft.

If you are transferring fuel from/to a large tank from/to small tanks, you can click the large tank and alt-click all the smaller ones and either press in or out on the large tank to automatically feed/draw from/to multiple tanks from/to the large one without going through each smaller tank. Does not save pumping time directly, but it does save the trouble of having to go through each tank manually.
